tvCnYa9a9HMoakqB3.notes: Usable once per hour of play

mJDxtNTGmTeKyhDsC.notes: @Magical powers in a non-magical world, higher TL equipment, grants special powers or is supernatural@

features.situation: to others' Hearing roll in siturations where you want to be heard over noise

mBf5nVSsikct2RMmw.name: People Affected
mBf5nVSsikct2RMmw.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

features.situation: from those who hold you in high regard for being a @Reason@, in a @Type: Feared, Respected or Venerated@ way.

tVRt-0sS7wmE8xWlP.name: Talent (any Talent appropriate to the patron deity) [5-15/level]

features.situation: from others who can hear your voice
from members of your religion and those who respect your faith

T51-Dy90uMse9MThj.name: Up to 40 points; put leftovers into known spells

tM_-fK8YoGlGagktp.name: Charitable
tM_-fK8YoGlGagktp.notes: Make a self-control roll in any situation where you could render aid or are specifically asked for help, but should resist the urge

tNcG7nffXn6BOMg4s.name: Gluttony
tNcG7nffXn6BOMg4s.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with a tempting morsel or good wine that, for some reason, you should resist. If you fail, you partake – regardless of the consequences.

tyXceKSgZ4reArlcw.name: Greed
tyXceKSgZ4reArlcw.notes: Make a self-control roll any time riches are offered – as payment for fair work, gains from adventure, spoils of crime, or just bait. If you fail, you do whatever it takes to get the payoff.

teuN6MIzemHTtlAXE.name: Miserliness
teuN6MIzemHTtlAXE.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to spend money. If the expenditure is large, this roll may be at -5 or worse (GM’s decision). If you fail, you refuse to spend the money.

ta4YPdKpt-FbXMumB.name: Obsession
ta4YPdKpt-FbXMumB.notes: @Goal@; Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to deviate from your goal. If you fail, you continue to pursue your Obsession, regardless of the consequences.

toqVbQQW8HOVM1-da.name: Overconfidence
toqVbQQW8HOVM1-da.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

tnIrzMCjPp9xxPgmQ.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
tnIrzMCjPp9xxPgmQ.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

tECcZZ7Zp8ZVneL3t.name: Pacifism: Cannot Kill
tECcZZ7Zp8ZVneL3t.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may never do anything that seems likely to kill another. This includes abandoning a wounded foe to die “on his own”! You must do your best to keep your companions from killing, too. If you do kill someone (or feel responsible for a death), you immediately suffer a nervous breakdown. Roll 3d and be totally morose and useless for that many days. During this time, you must make a Will roll to offer any sort of violence toward anyone, for any reason.

tO8P9WaeqOdgokl94.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
tO8P9WaeqOdgokl94.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

t7m7aFnc0qJIq_iay.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
t7m7aFnc0qJIq_iay.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

tHyzIOyWpQd1pZZAM.name: Pacifism: Total Nonviolence
tHyzIOyWpQd1pZZAM.notes: You will not lift a hand against another intelligent creature, for any reason. You must do your nonviolent best to discourage violent behavior in others, too. You are free to defend yourself against attacks by animals, mosquitoes, etc.

tEExWFKWMiWRgQR5-.name: Post-Combat Shakes
tEExWFKWMiWRgQR5-.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

tJrna2ZFD8p60Ltg0.name: Selfless
tJrna2ZFD8p60Ltg0.notes: You must make a self-control roll to put your needs – even survival – before those of someone else.

t9U4c819dCUK0W6Rx.name: Truthfulness
t9U4c819dCUK0W6Rx.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

tGyN5VMEy_DXZLM_u.name: Unfit
tGyN5VMEy_DXZLM_u.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate

features.situation: to all HT rolls to remain conscious, avoid death, resist disease or poison, etc

tGsqkq4HPYYUIOcY_.name: Very Unfit
tGsqkq4HPYYUIOcY_.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate and recover FP at only half the normal rate

features.situation: -2 to all HT rolls to remain conscious, avoid death, resist disease or poison, etc.

TEqaKyj-0p5uR4Cp8.name: One -10-point self-imposed disadvantage or two -5-point self-imposed disadvantages to be used with the Pact limitation for Divine Empowerment and all divine abilities and spells. Should be chosen appropriate to the patron deity’s dogma.

tXLCFVX9_D-h-Nd2R.name: Honesty
tXLCFVX9_D-h-Nd2R.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)
from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)

Tok-zDk7QBisNlx3g.name: Spells
Tok-zDk7QBisNlx3g.notes: 20 points in known spells and Domain Skills, which are Very Hard IQ skills, and appropriate divine abilities. Each Domain Skill should have from 1 to 8 points put into it, and is modified by Clerical Talent.

sM4FLYrHgqHoTPWwv.name: Area Knowledge
sM4FLYrHgqHoTPWwv.notes: General nature of its settlements and towns, political allegiances, leaders, and most citizens of Status 5+

sEZO4pmY2cvEkiJbk.name: Area Knowledge
sEZO4pmY2cvEkiJbk.notes: All important businesses, streets, citizens, leaders, etc.

sc5uhIEDSHgkMsTWK.name: Area Knowledge
sc5uhIEDSHgkMsTWK.notes: Location of its major cities and important sites; awareness of its major customs, ethnic groups, and languages (but not necessarily expertise); names of folk of Status 6+; and a general understanding of the economic and political situation

sHcfsg3vW23E7HPmV.name: Area Knowledge
sHcfsg3vW23E7HPmV.notes: The inhabitants, trails, streams, hiding places, ambush sites, flora, and fauna of a few hundred acres

suVb4Hi33-xvJnuHc.name: Area Knowledge
suVb4Hi33-xvJnuHc.notes: The residents and buildings of a few city blocks

sCeyGLE2Pi765iHnd.name: Area Knowledge
sCeyGLE2Pi765iHnd.notes: All important citizens and businesses, and most unimportant ones; all public buildings and most houses

SEJEqBPfOn6X6B4Vm.name: One of these three melee skills packages
